name: publish-arete
goal: Make Areté installable directly from GitHub so early users can try it without waiting for npm publish via `npm install -g github:johnkoht/arete`

userStories.title: Fix root package.json for GitHub install
userStories.description: Update root package.json to fix dependency resolution and add required metadata for GitHub-based npm installs. Change workspace:* to file: protocol, fix inquirer dependency mismatch, add repository and author fields.

userStories.title: Fix getSourcePaths() for external install
userStories.description: Simplify getSourcePaths() in packages/core/src/compat/workspace.ts to always return packages/runtime/ paths. Remove the useRuntime parameter and update all callers in packages/cli/src/commands/.

userStories.title: Test fresh clone + local install
userStories.description: Verify the fix works by cloning the repo fresh to /tmp and testing the install flow locally. Must push changes to GitHub first, then clone and test.
acceptanceCriteria: Changes committed and pushed to GitHub
Fresh clone `npm install` completes without error

userStories.title: Test global GitHub install end-to-end
userStories.description: Test the full user experience: global install from GitHub, then create a workspace. This is the final validation that the feature works as intended.
